description.narrative:
The Livelihood Initiatives For Empowerment (LIFE) was designed to empower vulnerable women for better income generation with dignity restored. LIFE will empower 104 war affected vulnerable women in the Mullaitivu District in Northern Province of Sri Lanka. The project was designed as phase II of Wanni Women Livelihood Program and will be implemented in 6 months.
The 27 year old conflict in Sri Lanka ended in May 2009. The civil war has resulted most young men and women either killed, disabled or in the detention camps. Women headed families are challenged to provide and protect their families. The brutal killing and the prolonged stay in the Internally Displaced Persons (IDP) camps has traumatized the women and children. In addition, the women lack access to marketing and credit facilities to ensure sustainable income. They struggle to provide three meals to their children.
The grant aims to provide livelihood initiatives for empowerment through mobilization of a cooperative society, technical training on home gardening/goat rearing for quality and quantity production, marketing linkage through FCCISL and expansion of Livelihoods for 104 vulnerable women.
The objective of LIFE is to empower the women entrepreneurs for better access to a wider marketing network and to increase sustainable income to provide and protect their families.
